meanings.definition: A substance used to give a particular taste to food or drink.
meanings.sent1: I added a pinch of flavouring to the soup to make it tastier.
meanings.sent2: The vanilla flavouring enhanced the sweetness of the cake.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef secretly added extra flavouring to the salad, causing a flavor explosion.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of flavouring in the dull room, instantly brightening the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The flavouring danced on my taste buds, leaving a delightful sensation behind.

meanings.definition: The process of adding a particular taste to food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The flavouring of the curry involved a blend of aromatic spices.
meanings.sent2: During the cooking class, we learned about the art of flavouring dishes.
meanings.sent3: As the chef twirled around the kitchen, the flavouring of the stew seemed to follow his every move.
meanings.sent4: The music in the restaurant added a unique flavouring to the dining experience.
meanings.sent5: The flavouring of the tea was done with precision, resulting in a perfectly balanced brew.
